text: Had a good chat w/ Arrow (someone higher up the chain than Stephen) about partnering w/ PMMC. In that convo, she mentioned that Arrow has a program for certifying companies like ours as preferred partners. (Arrow Certified Engineering Services). They bring projects to the table where our services (design, electrical engineering, IoT) would be useful. They make money on the number of components they sell.
Rigado is a current partner of theirs, though theyâ€™re about to cease being a services company.
Didn't they also invest in indiegogo?

Just met w/ Jennifer Nolfi, who is the Executive Director, Center for Retail at PSU. Shared a bit about PMMC and our vision for Portland and IOT. Looks like there are a number of opps to collaborate with them, potentially even helping them set up an IoT program that is cross-disciplinary across food, apparel, and their business school.
More to come on that front.

attachments.fallback: <https://twitter.com/equartey|@equartey>: Huh - Facebook has a new hardware arm called Building 8. Amongst other roles, they're hiring for a Brain-Computer Interface Engineer. <https://pbs.twimg.com/media/C5f6F4MWMAAlGyp.jpg>
